newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African stock market closing report.
newsitem.headline: S.African stock market closing report.

text.p: South African golds ended softer on Tuesday after the bullion price failed to escape its weak levels, while industrial shares finished firm after a slow start, dealers said.
They said sentiment in industrials was initially hit by the gold price but started to recover around noon.

"We had a softer start weighed down by golds. It has started to pick up in industrials with Barlows and some tech stock making the running," James Scott, equity marketing manager at Societe General Frankel Pollack, told Reuters.
Some offshore buying was seen during the day and volumes were moderate with a few big deals in some shares.
Gencor traded over seven million shares, boosted by a bookover of five million shares, taking up about 17 percent of total market volume of 819 million rand.

Profurn saw around five million shares change hands in a foreign purchase worth over 11 million rand. Profurn ended up four cents to 200 cents as South African furniture sector continues strong in anticipation of an interest rate cut.
PPC also saw large volumes with over 17 million rand worth of shares changing hands. It was last up 250 cents to 71.50 rand.
The industrial index gained 43.2 points to 8,885.7 points, the gold index lost 23.3 points to 976.3 points and the all-share index dropped 10.1 points to 7,390.7 points.
In the broader market, advancers led decliners by 195 to 179 with 29 issues reaching new highs compared to 10 which hit new lows.

The market was seen continuing in the same vein on Wednesday in a moderately optimistic mood and as players kept hoping for a long awaited interest rate cut. Economists polled last month by Reuters said a one-point cut may be possible by the end of the third quarter and a certainty by the end of the year.
Gold shares were seen nervous on the rollercoaster bullion price.
Hicor fell to a new year low of 54 cents after posting lower earnings per share for the 15 months ended March 31. It ended down a cent to 60 cents.
Tempora gained 40 cents to a new year high of 28.20 rand after the company posted a slight improvement in earnings for the year ended June 30, dealers said.

Near-term futures recovered most of their morning losses with the gold share contracts steady as the bullion price was about a dollar firmer from the start and the industrial futures firmer on a recovery in local bonds.
Dealers said there were no real sellers in the market and trade was seen positive on Wednesday.
The September all-share contract was last at 6,712/17 from 6,716, the industrial contract was at 8,580/88 from 8,568 and the gold contract was at 687/693 from 700.
